name: Summer Sessions 2020
description: Green Light mentors were invited to host virtual workshops for the mentorship community! The workshop themes ranged from personal interest workshops to professional development workshops to tips for surviving university. Some of our workshops included: Standing Out as an Applicant for Incoming and Applying Students, Business and Non-Profit Organization Essentials, The Unemphasized Impacts of Your Habits, Introduction to Programming, Branch out! : Networking and Job Apps 101, Be Financially Fit by ACE. We are so thankful to our terrific mentors for hosting such creative and informative workshops!

name: Virtual Ontario University Fair
description: In light of the cancellation of the official Ontario University Fair (OUF) due to COVID-19, we hosted a 2-day virtual OUF to help high school students & parents access first-hand information from university students. This event featured an array of workshops hosted by over 50 mentors that touched on various topics such as the application process, the transition from the high school to university, university features, etc. Students and parents were provided with the chance to interact with current university students and hear about their first hand experiences.

name: All About Applications
description: As a part of our monthly workshop series, we focused on preparing high school students for university applications and interviews. We wanted to provide high school students with an inside look at how the application process will likely look like for them!

name: Introduction to Applying to University
description: This workshop targeted Grade 9-11 High School students and was all about the university application process, resources when applying, clearing misconceptions & general tips. The event consisted of a 30 minute presentation by speakers from popular programs at varying universities and was followed by a 15 minute Q&A session!

name: International Student 101
description: An introduction to applying to Canadian Universities as an international high school student. The speakers provided first hand experiences & answered questions regarding the application process. To view these interviews, check out our Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaa8io9P-LfoMMK19yYeo6g/videos.

name: Building Your Mental Health Toolkit
description: The speakers who were upper-years aimed to prepare the incoming first years mentally, emotionally, and physically for their transition to in-person university by sharing their experiences. It started with a main keynote speaker sharing a general talk about the central theme. Then, moved into breakout rooms surrounding 3 pillars: physical, emotional and mental well-being.

name: The Crossroads 2021
description: This event featured various field-specific panels aimed to help grade 12s, compare and contrast various programs within the same fields before committing to a program and university.

name: Academic Skills Workshop
description: The academic skills workshop will focus on equipping incoming first years with strategies and resources to face any possible obstacles. This workshop will include a moderated Q&A presentation with talking points & then move to a live Q&A with questions from the attendees.
